title: Thor 2 Casting is Set to Begin August 2012
content:
The next chapter in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, "Thor 2" is now in pre-production and the casting director in Los Angeles is getting ready to audition talent for new co-starring and supporting roles. The bulk of filming will take place in London, England with some additional filming in Los Angeles. There will also be auditions in London for principal acting roles. Extras, photo-doubles, and stand-ins will be hired in London and various areas of the United Kingdom. Filming on "Thor 2" will begin in August, 2012.

Returning for this second "Thor" installment is People's Choice Award and Teen Choice Award nominee Chris Hemsworth as Thor; Academy Award winner Natalie Portman as Jane Foster; BAFTA Award nominee Tom Hiddleston as Loki; Golden Globe winner Idris Elba as Heimdall; British actor Ray Stevenson as Volstagg; Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror Films nominee Jaimie Alexander as Sif; and Joshua Dallas as Fandral. Primetime Emmy Award winning filmmaker Alan Taylor will direct "Thor 2" from a screenplay rewritten by Robert Rodat from original drafts by Don Payne, based on the Marvel Comics by Jack Kirby, Stan Lee, and Larry Lieber. Alan Taylor is highly respected for his outstanding directorial work on HBO's "Game of Thrones". His other credits include "Sex and the City," "Lost," "The Sopranos," and "Mad Men". Prior to the studio signing Alan Taylor, Patty Jenkins was set to direct "Thor" but left the project in December 2011, citing "creative differences".

title: Apple Is Testing Watch-Like Device
content:
Apple's Next Innovation: The Watch-Like Device

In the world of technology, Apple has been a trailblazer, consistently pushing the boundaries of innovation. From the iconic iPhone to the revolutionary AirPods, their products have transformed the way we interact with technology. Now, there's a buzz in the tech community about Apple's latest endeavor: a watch-like device. While details are still shrouded in secrecy, the potential implications of such a device are nothing short of groundbreaking.

The Evolution of Wearable Tech

Wearable technology has come a long way since the days of basic fitness trackers. Today, smartwatches have become an integral part of our lives, seamlessly integrating with our smartphones to provide a range of functionalities from health monitoring to notifications. With Apple's reputation for refining existing technologies and setting new standards, the prospect of a watch-like device from the tech giant has generated immense excitement.

What We Know So Far

As of now, Apple has been tight-lipped about the specifics of this watch-like device. However, speculations and leaks from various sources offer some intriguing insights. It's believed that the device will feature a sleek, minimalist design, akin to their current lineup of products. The display is expected to be high-resolution and may incorporate cutting-edge OLED technology for vibrant colors and deep blacks.

A Fusion of Functionality

One can anticipate that Apple's watch-like device will seamlessly integrate with existing Apple products, creating a unified ecosystem. This means it will likely sync with your iPhone, MacBook, and other devices, allowing for a seamless transfer of information and functionality. The device is also expected to incorporate advanced health and fitness tracking capabilities, potentially rivaling dedicated fitness wearables.

The Impact on the Market

If Apple's track record is any indication, the introduction of a watch-like device could have far-reaching implications. It could potentially disrupt the wearable tech market, setting new standards for design, functionality, and user experience. Competitors will undoubtedly be watching closely, striving to keep pace with Apple's latest innovation.

The Potential Beyond the Wrist

While the primary focus is on its watch-like form, the potential of this device could extend beyond the wrist. Speculations suggest that it may incorporate augmented reality (AR) features, opening up new avenues for immersive experiences. Whether it's for gaming, navigation, or interactive applications, the integration of AR could mark a significant leap forward in wearable technology.

The Wait for a Game-Changer

As with any Apple product release, the anticipation is palpable. While we may not have all the details, the prospect of a watch-like device from Apple is undeniably exciting. If history is any indication, it will likely be a game-changer, setting new standards for wearable technology and reshaping how we interact with the digital world.

In the meantime, all eyes are on Apple as we eagerly await further announcements and, ultimately, the unveiling of this potentially revolutionary device. One thing is for certain: whatever Apple has in store, it's bound to leave a lasting mark on the world of technology. Stay tuned for updates, as the future of wearables is about to take a giant leap forward.
